alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Cherry, northern Rock, northern Brown and central Keya Paha Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springview to near Valentine National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Long Pine, Johnstown, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Norden, Wood Lake, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Moon Lake, Meadville, North River Trail, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 211 and 254. Highway 83 between mile markers 172 and 197. Highway 12 between mile markers 30 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock; Western Cherry
